alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 10:26PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1024 PM EST, gauge reports indicated minor flooding is ongoing along the Rocky River near Irish Buffalo Creek. The river has crested with a stage of 13.5 feet and falling. At 12 feet, flooding from Back Creek may approach but not reach Pharr Mill Road due to backwater effects from Rocky River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg, Mt Pleasant and Charlotte Motor Speedway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
